Bases: mlutils.model.forecasting_interface.ForecastingModelInterface

Parameters

  • test_data_df –

  • horizon_length –

Returns

list of forecasts for each forecast point in the given test_data_df. Each forecast is of length horizon_length

property series¶
class mlutils.model.forecasting_baselines.MovingAverage(window_size, whole_series: Optional[pandas.core.series.Series] = None, target_column=None)¶

Bases: mlutils.model.forecasting_baselines.BaselineBase

Forecasted value is the moving average of a sliding window. For longer horizons (larger than window_size) the sliding

window calculates the moving average of previously calculated averages

forecast(horizon_size, forecast_point_index, dynamic=True, index_or_label=False)¶
Parameters

  • horizon_size – size of the forecasting horizon

  • forecast_point_index – index after which the forecasting will begin

  • dynamic – True for true forecasts,

  • index_or_label – False to use the integer index of the series, True to use actual index (For example datetime if the series has a DateTimeIndex)

Returns

series containing the forecasts indexed by the same index of the original series

hyperparameters()¶
Returns

dict describing model hyperparameters, by default returns an empty dict

property name¶
Returns

Name of the model

class mlutils.model.forecasting_baselines.Naive(whole_series: Optional[pandas.core.series.Series] = None, target_column=None)¶

Bases: mlutils.model.forecasting_baselines.BaselineBase

Simply returns the last know value as the prediction for the whole horizon

forecast(horizon_size, forecast_point_index, dynamic=True, index_or_label=False)¶
Parameters

  • horizon_size – size of the forecasting horizon

  • forecast_point_index – index after which the forecasting will begin

  • dynamic – True for true forecasts,

  • index_or_label – False to use the integer index of the series, True to use actual index (For example datetime if the series has a DateTimeIndex)

Returns

series containing the forecasts indexed by the same index of the original series

property name¶
Returns

Name of the model

class mlutils.model.forecasting_baselines.NaiveSeasonal(seasonal_period, whole_series: Optional[pandas.core.series.Series] = None, target_column=None)¶

Bases: mlutils.model.forecasting_baselines.BaselineBase

Forecasted value is the value before seasonal_period of the currently forecasted index

forecast(horizon_size, forecast_point_index, dynamic=True, index_or_label=False)¶

Fit the model on the given data

Parameters

train_data_df –

forecast(forecast_point_index, horizon_length)¶
Parameters

  • forecast_point_index – Starting point of the forecast

  • horizon_length – Length of the forecasting horizon

Returns

list of horizon_length forecasted values starting from the given forecast_point_index

mlutils.model.model_interface module¶

Module for tracking created models. This module is a silly way of ensuring that every model with same hyperparameters returns the same ID for easier comparison of models.

class mlutils.model.model_interface.Model¶

Bases: object

hyperparameters()¶
Returns

dict describing model hyperparameters, by default returns an empty dict

property name¶
Returns

Name of the model

property shared_id¶
Returns

unique identifier of the model that should be the same for models with same hyperparameters
